cityfarmers.farmland

Class FarmlandPlanter

  • java.lang.Object
    • cityfarmers.farmland.FarmlandPlanter

  • public class FarmlandPlanter
extends java.lang.Object
    The FarmlandPlanter class facilitates the interaction between the database and the FarmlandCtrl for Planting Methods
    Version:
    1.0 08 Apr 2020
    Author:
    Wan Ding Yang

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FarmlandPlanter()
      Creates a WelcomeCtrl object with a default farmland Viewer, Inventory Manager, CDM and PDM

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty(Plot plot)
        The isEmpty method checks if the plot is empty.
        Parameters:
        plot - selected plot to check if empty
        Returns:
        true if plot is empty, false otherwise

      • chooseCrop

        public Crop chooseCrop(int choice,
                       java.util.Map<Crop,java.lang.Integer> userCrops)
        The chooseCrop method takes in the user crops and initialises a do while loop to choose the selected crop for planting.
        Parameters:
        choice - the user's index choice of crop
        userCrops - a map of the corresponding amount of crops a user has
        Returns:
        the crop object corresponding to the user's choice

      • plant

        public char plant(java.lang.String input,
                  User loggedInUser)
        Plant the user's plots if valid.
        Parameters:
        input - user input
        loggedInUser - the user
        Returns:
        character of user input, default is '-'

      • checkPlant

        public boolean checkPlant(Plot plot)
        The checkPlant method checks if the selected plot is empty, and returns the plot.
        Parameters:
        plot - the plot
        Returns:
        plot ready to plant or null if plot is filled

      • getPlotByInput

        public static Plot getPlotByInput(java.util.List<Plot> plots,
                                  java.lang.String input)
                           throws InvalidPlotException
        Checks whether specified user's input is valid to get the chosen plot, if valid returns plot If not valid, throws InvalidPlotException with error message
        Parameters:
        plots - the List of Plots to choose from
        input - the user's input indicating the plot number
        Returns:
        the Plot object referred by input if valid
        Throws:
        InvalidPlotException - If invalid input, exception with error message is thrown

      • plantPlot

        public void plantPlot(User loggedinUser,
                      Plot plot,
                      Crop crop)
        The plantPlot method updates the number of user's crops and plants the crops
        Parameters:
        loggedinUser - the user
        plot - chosen plot
        crop - chosen crop
